notes.title: Legal Notice

notes.text: An attacker with physical access to the Kantech Gen1 ioSmart card reader in certain circumstances can recover the reader's communication memory between the card and reader.
notes.title: Risk evaluation

notes.text: CISA recommends users take defensive measures to minimize the risk of exploitation of this vulnerability, such as:
notes.title: Recommended Practices

notes.text: Minimize network exposure for all control system devices and/or systems, ensuring they are not accessible from the internet.
notes.title: Recommended Practices

notes.text: Locate control system networks and remote devices behind firewalls and isolating them from business networks.
notes.title: Recommended Practices

notes.text: When remote access is required, use more secure methods, such as Virtual Private Networks (VPNs), recognizing VPNs may have vulnerabilities and should be updated to the most current version available. Also recognize VPN is only as secure as the connected devices.
notes.title: Recommended Practices

notes.text: CISA reminds organizations to perform proper impact analysis and risk assessment prior to deploying defensive measures.
notes.title: Recommended Practices

notes.text: CISA also provides a section for control systems security recommended practices on the ICS webpage on cisa.gov/ics. Several CISA products detailing cyber defense best practices are available for reading and download, including Improving Industrial Control Systems Cybersecurity with Defense-in-Depth Strategies.
notes.title: Recommended Practices

notes.text: CISA encourages organizations to implement recommended cybersecurity strategies for proactive defense of ICS assets.
notes.title: Recommended Practices

notes.text: Additional mitigation guidance and recommended practices are publicly available on the ICS webpage at cisa.gov/ics in the technical information paper, ICS-TIP-12-146-01B--Targeted Cyber Intrusion Detection and Mitigation Strategies.
notes.title: Recommended Practices

notes.text: Organizations observing suspected malicious activity should follow established internal procedures and report findings to CISA for tracking and correlation against other incidents.
notes.title: Recommended Practices

notes.text: No known public exploitation specifically targeting this this vulnerability has been reported to CISA at this time. This vulnerability is not exploitable remotely. This vulnerability has a high attack complexity.
notes.title: Recommended Practices

product.name: Sensormatic Electronics, LLC, an affiliate of Johnson Controls Inc. Kantech Gen1 ioSmart card reader firmware: <1.7.2

branches.name: Kantech Gen1 ioSmart card reader firmware
Sensormatic Electronics, LLC, an affiliate of Johnson Controls Inc.

cwe.name: Missing Release of Memory after Effective Lifetime

notes.text: Kantech Gen1 ioSmart card readers with firmware versions prior to 1.7.2 do not properly release memory after its effective lifetime. An attacker with physical access to the Kantech Gen1 ioSmart card reader in certain circumstances can recover the reader's communication memory between the card and reader. CWE-200: Exposure of Sensitive Information to an Unauthorized Actor also applies to this vulnerability.
notes.title: Vulnerability Summary

remediations.details: Johnson Controls recommends users update their Kantech Gen1 ioSmart card reader firmware to version 1.7.2 or higher.
Johnson Controls also makes the following recommendations and wishes to provide the following information:
Contact technical support for additional information.
ioSmart Gen2 card readers are not affected by this vulnerability.
Users should contact their local sales representative for ordering information.

For more detailed mitigation instructions, please see Johnson Controls Product Security Advisory JCI-PSA-2023-03 v1. Further ICS security notices and product security guidelines can also be found at this website.
